content:
Sure, here are the updated steps for creating a mobile app instead of a web app using Amplify Studio:

1. Sign in to the AWS Management Console and navigate to the Amplify service.
2. Click the "Create App" button.
3. Choose "Mobile App" as the app type.
4. Select the platform for your mobile app (iOS, Android, or React Native).
5. Choose your preferred development framework (e.g. Swift for iOS or Java/Kotlin for Android).
6. Enter a name for your app and click "Create App".
7. Once your app is created, navigate to the "Backend Environment" section and click "Create new environment".
8. Choose a name for your environment and select the type of environment you want to create (e.g. "Dev" or "Prod").
9. Choose the backend services you want to include in your environment (e.g. Amazon Polly for text-to-speech and Amazon S3 for file storage).
10. Configure the settings for each service you selected (e.g. the S3 bucket name and region).
11. Click "Save and Deploy" to create your backend environment.
12. Once your backend environment is created, you can use Amplify Studio to create your mobile app's user interface and connect it to your backend services.
